articles.headline: Chief of Dentsu, Japanese Ad Agency, to Resign Over Employee’s Suicide
articles.snippet: Tadashi Ishii apologized and took responsibility for the death, and for a culture of dangerously long work hours.
articles.abstract: Tadashi Ishii apologized and took responsibility for the death, and for a culture of dangerously long work hours.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — In the months before she jumped to her death from a company dormitory last Christmas, a young employee at a Japanese advertising agency told friends on Twitter of enduring harassment and grueling long hours on the job.

articles.headline: Kerry Rebukes Israel, Calling Settlements a Threat to Peace
articles.snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry argued that Israel could not survive as both a Jewish state and a democratic state unless it embraced a two-state plan.
articles.abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry argued that Israel could not survive as both a Jewish state and a democratic state unless it embraced a two-state plan.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Secretary of State John Kerry accused Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Wednesday of thwarting peace in the Middle East, speaking with a clarity and harshness almost never heard from American diplomats when discussing one of their closest and strongest allies.

articles.headline: When Finding the Right Lawyer Seems Daunting, Crowdsource One
articles.snippet: A new online service connects those needing legal services with lawyers who pay to be listed on the site. Some state bars are taking an interest in the model.
articles.abstract: A new online service connects those needing legal services with lawyers who pay to be listed on the site. Some state bars are taking an interest in the model.
articles.lead_paragraph: To resolve a legal dispute, the first thing many do is try to hire a lawyer. Too often, that is easier said than done.

articles.headline: As Chicago Murder Rate Spikes, Many Fear Violence Has Become Normalized
articles.snippet: Activists are despairing over the ceaseless bloodshed in Chicago, where more than 750 people were murdered in 2016, a 58 percent increase.
articles.abstract: Activists are despairing over the ceaseless bloodshed in Chicago, where more than 750 people were murdered in 2016, a 58 percent increase.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — The nation’s third-largest city will end 2016 with a surging murder rate, a demoralized and distrusted police force and a weary populace that has become inured to daily reports of shootings.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: In John Kerry’s Mideast Speech, a Clash of Policies and Personalities
articles.snippet: On one side, were Mr. Kerry and President Obama. On the other, President-elect Donald J. Trump and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, and time is on their side.
articles.abstract: On one side, were Mr. Kerry and President Obama. On the other, President-elect Donald J. Trump and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, and time is on their side.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Even before Secretary of State John Kerry issued his scathing critique of Israeli policies on Wednesday, President-elect Donald J. Trump essentially told Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to ignore it.

articles.headline: Germany Grapples With Its African Genocide
articles.snippet: Tens of thousands of Namibians were killed in what historians call the 20th century’s first genocide, and Germany is finally close to recognizing it as such.
articles.abstract: Tens of thousands of Namibians were killed in what historians call the 20th century’s first genocide, and Germany is finally close to recognizing it as such.
articles.lead_paragraph: WATERBERG, Namibia — In this faraway corner of southern Africa, scores of German soldiers lie in a military cemetery, their names, dates and details engraved on separate polished tombstones.

articles.headline: How China Built ‘iPhone City’ With Billions in Perks for Apple’s Partner
articles.snippet: A hidden bounty of benefits for Foxconn’s plant in Zhengzhou, the world’s biggest iPhone factory, is central to the production of Apple’s most profitable product.
articles.abstract: A hidden bounty of benefits for Foxconn’s plant in Zhengzhou, the world’s biggest iPhone factory, is central to the production of Apple’s most profitable product.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZHENGZHOU, China — A vast, boxy customs center acts as a busy island of commerce deep in central China.
